means: （用以构成复合词）肩膀…的，背着的
承担( shoulder的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He shouldered his bike and walked across the finish line.
sentence.Network_cn: 他扛着自行车走过了终点线。

sentence.Network_en: He was a big man of about forty, wide-shouldered and heavily built.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是个40岁左右的高大男子，肩宽体壮。
锡西不仅驼背，而且又矮又胖。

entry.def: Your shoulders are between your neck and the tops of your arms.

example.ex: She led him to an armchair, with her arm round his shoulder...
example.tran: 她揽着他的肩膀，将他领到一把扶手椅旁。

example.ex: He glanced over his shoulder and saw me watching him.
example.tran: 他扭头瞥了一眼，看见我正看他。

entry.def: The shoulders of a piece of clothing are the parts that cover your shoulders.

example.ex: ...extravagant fashions with padded shoulders.
example.tran: 带垫肩的华丽时装

entry.tran: (问题、责任等)由…承担，落在…肩上
entry.def: When you talk about someone's problems or responsibilities, you can say that they carry them on their shoulders .

example.ex: No one suspected the anguish he carried on his shoulders...
example.tran: 没人觉察出他所承担的痛苦。

example.ex: I fervently hope he recognizes and understands the burden that's on his shoulders.
example.tran: 我热诚地希望他能认识到并懂得自己肩负的重任。

entry.def: If you shoulder the responsibility or the blame for something, you accept it.

example.ex: He has had to shoulder the responsibility of his father's mistakes...
example.tran: 他得为他父亲的过错承担责任。

example.ex: Some of the blame for the disastrous night must be shouldered by the promoters.
example.tran: 筹办方必须为那个灾难性的夜晚承担一部分责任。

entry.def: If you shoulder something heavy, you put it across one of your shoulders so that you can carry it more easily.

example.ex: The rest of the group shouldered their bags, gritted their teeth and set off...
example.tran: 那群人中其余的人扛起包，咬着牙出发了。

example.ex: He shouldered his bike and walked across the finish line.
example.tran: 他扛着自行车走过了终点线。

entry.def: If you shoulder someone aside or if you shoulder your way somewhere, you push past people roughly using your shoulder.

example.ex: The policemen rushed past him, shouldering him aside...
example.tran: 警察从他身边匆匆而过，把他挤到一边。

example.ex: She could do nothing to stop him as he shouldered his way into the house...
example.tran: 他使劲往屋子里挤，她根本没法儿阻止他。

entry.def: A shoulder is a joint of meat from the upper part of the front leg of an animal.

example.ex: ...shoulder of lamb.
example.tran: 小羊的前腿连肩肉

entry.def: If someone offers you a shoulder to cry on or is a shoulder to cry on, they listen sympathetically as you talk about your troubles.

example.ex: Mrs Barrantes longs to be at her daughter's side to offer her a shoulder to cry on...
example.tran: 巴兰特斯夫人很希望能在女儿身边听她倾诉。

example.ex: Roland sometimes saw me as a shoulder to cry on.
example.tran: 罗兰有时把我看作是一个可以倾诉的对象。

entry.def: If you say that someone or something stands head and shoulders above other people or things, you mean that they are a lot better than them.

example.ex: The two candidates stood head and shoulders above the rest...
example.tran: 这两名候选人从所有人中脱颖而出。

example.ex: I am very impressed by your magazine. It is head and shoulders above any other.
example.tran: 我对你们的杂志印象非常深刻。感觉比其他杂志好多了。

entry.tran: 惴惴不安;小心翼翼;小心提防
entry.def: If you say that someone is looking over their shoulder, you mean that they feel anxious all the time about what someone may do to them.

example.ex: When a company keeps making people redundant, those who are left behind might start looking over their shoulder.
example.tran: 当一家公司不停地裁员时，那些留下来的员工也会开始惴惴不安了。

entry.def: If two or more people stand shoulder to shoulder, they are standing next to each other, with their shoulders touching.

example.ex: They fell into step, walking shoulder to shoulder with their heads bent against the rain...
example.tran: 他们开始迈着一致的步伐并肩而行，低着头躲避雨水。

example.ex: We went on board and saw these people packed shoulder to shoulder on the decks.
example.tran: 我们上了船，看见这些人在甲板上肩挨着肩挤在一起。

entry.def: If people work or stand shoulder to shoulder, they work together in order to achieve something, or support each other.

example.ex: They could fight shoulder-to-shoulder against a common enemy...
example.tran: 他们可以同心协力，对抗共同的敌人。

example.ex: We will need you and the chairman standing shoulder to shoulder on basic positions.
example.tran: 我们需要你和主席在一些基本立场上共同进退。

means.word_mean: 1. having shoulders or shoulders as specified; usually used as a combining form;

auth_sentence.content: He comes forward slowly, slightly stoop-shouldered, septuagenarian.
auth_sentence.res_content: He comes forward slowly, slightly stoop-shouldered, septuagenarian.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He comes forward slowly, slightly stoop-shouldered, septuagenarian.

auth_sentence.content: The figure was large and broad-shouldered, long-armed and stooped.
auth_sentence.res_content: The figure was large and broad-shouldered, long-armed and stooped.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The figure was large and broad-shouldered, long-armed and stooped.

auth_sentence.content: The model wore a bone-white Stetson that matched his broad-shouldered jacket.
auth_sentence.res_content: The model wore a bone-white Stetson that matched his broad-shouldered jacket.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The model wore a bone-white Stetson that matched his broad-shouldered jacket.
